item.title: Report I-2024100076
item.description:
Report I-2024100076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR ENVIRONMENTAL SOLUTIONS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver returned to the facility and was unloading his van trailer of all waste drums and totes. He went to move one of the 275 gallon totes and pulled too far into the tote and the forklift forks struck a drum behind lhe tote puncturing that drum causing it to leak. The driver as well as our warehouse associates quickly and safely acted to tum the drum on its side to limit the amount of liquid that leaked out- approximately 15 gallons. Speedi dry as well as absorbent pads were placed in the trailer to contain the spill. The drum was placed into and overpack drum and all the solid debris was scooped up and drummed as well.

item.title: Report E-2024100386
item.description:
Report E-2024100386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, two (2) 55-pound bag of Caustic Soda Micropearls were torn during unloading and released approximately one-half (0.5) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized degreasing agent and absorbents to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel utilized hand tools to dismantle the impacted pallet. All impacted materials and the damaged bags were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100324
item.description:
Report E-2024100324

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: EUCLID
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, at 1154 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Euclid, OH regarding the release of Paraformaldehyde Prills 91-93%. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 150 lbs of Paraformaldehyde Prills 91-93% (UN2213, 4.1, III) from (3) bags onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to impact from pallets during loading, affecting multiple areas in the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The contractors collected the release with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, which were then taken off site by contractors for proper disposal.
